doc.field: Jacksons et al. v. Ariss Buckner & Bernard H. Buckner. Affidavit of Ariss Buckner
jacksons et al. v. ariss buckner & bernard h. buckner. affidavit of ariss buckner
Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia, Local Government Records Collection, Arlington County Court Records, Arlington County (Va.) Judgments (Freedom Suits), 1795-1858, Box 2
Jennifer Guiliano; Trevor Muñoz; William G. Thomas III

{"label":"Fanny Jackson, Louisa Jackson, Robert Jackson, & Maria Jackson v. Ariss Buckner & Bernard H. Buckner","id":"oscys.caseid.0461"}
{"label":"Charles Taylor v. Ariss Buckner & Bernard H. Buckner","id":"oscys.caseid.0454"}

{"label":"Cassius Jackson v. Ariss Buckner & Bernard H. Buckner","id":"oscys.caseid.0462"}
United States. Circuit Court (District of Columbia) - Alexandria (Washington, D.C.)

District of Columbia, County of Washington. 81. Henry Jackson vs B. H. Buckner & Aris Buckner Pentn for freedom 82. Jenny Bill vs same id. 340. Charles Taylor vs same. id. 341. Alexander Brent vs same. id. 345. Cassius Jackson vs same. id. Aris Buckner one of the Defts in the above cases, makes oath in open court that he has good reason to think & believe, from credible & certain information, as well as from circumstances in his own knowledge, and does verily think & believe, that a fair & impartial trial of the said suits, or of any of them, cannot be had in the County of Washington, where such suits are depending: Wherefore he prays that the same be removed into the Court holden in Alexandria County. Test W. Brentk Clk 24 Decr. 1833 81 filed 24 Decr. 1833
United States. Circuit Court (District of Columbia) - Alexandria (Washington, D.C.)
